subject: Re: Alphabetical Order
msgSnippet: ... Another possibility would be to change the shape of one of the Awe or Ox letters so that they look very, very similar (maybe distinguish the two by a small
messageBody:
--- In Read_Alphabet@yahoogroups.com, "Anthony Grahn" <othermale@...>
wrote:
>
>
> Some choices, in reverse order of outrageousness:
> 1. re-examine the way lexical sets are assigned.
> 2. give up on an alphabetical ordering that puts all word of all
> accents together.
> 3. get rid of a letter (presumably merging Awe and Ox)
>

Another possibility would be to change the shape of one of the Awe or
Ox letters so that they look very, very similar (maybe distinguish the
two by a small feature such as a short dash).
Please note, I would like to be the first to say that this is the most
outrageous choice. It is too radical to me because, 1) Its breaking
Read's beautiful glyphs and 2) I'm Australian so I use all three Awe-Ah-
Ox vowels quite distinctly in everyday pronunciations.
